text: Charles Lewis Tiffany (February 15, 1812 â€“ February 18, 1902) was an American jewelry designer. He was a leader in the nineteenth century American jewelry trade. He founded New York City's Tiffany & Co. in 1837. He helped introduced the English standard of sterling silver in imported jewelry in 1851. ==References== Category:1812 births Category:1902 deaths Category:Businesspeople from New York City Category:Businesspeople from Connecticut
title: Charles Lewis Tiffany
